meanings.definition: A type of bow with curved ends resembling wings.
meanings.sent1: The archer aimed the wingbow at the target.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the wingbow.
meanings.sent3: The wingbow looked like a bird ready to take flight.
meanings.sent4: His skill with the wingbow was unmatched in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The wingbow's unique shape made it stand out among other bows.

meanings.definition: To shoot an arrow from a wingbow.
meanings.sent1: He carefully drew back the string of the wingbow.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her aim before wingbow hunting.
meanings.sent3: The archer wingbowed with precision and grace.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the wingbow releasing the arrow echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: Wingbowing requires focus and steady hands.

meanings.definition: The act of using a wingbow in archery.
meanings.sent1: His favorite part of archery was the wingbow practice.
meanings.sent2: She competed in the tournament with her trusted wingbow.
meanings.sent3: The wingbow competition drew skilled archers from all around.
meanings.sent4: The art of wingbow requires patience and dedication.
meanings.sent5: Using a wingbow in archery felt natural and empowering.
